macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Stocks End Week Mixed as Intel Plunges 17% on Weak Guidance
items.summary: The Dow fell 0.6% to 49,098.71, S&P 500 was flat at around 6,909-6,916, and Nasdaq rose 0.3% to 23,501 amid Intel's sharp decline due to disappointing revenue forecast and AI chip supply issues; Microsoft gained 3.3% and Nvidia 1.5% on tech rotation and China orders.

items.title: Fed Meeting Looms with Political Pressure on Independence and Rate Path
items.summary: Markets focus on the Federal Reserve meeting January 27-28, scrutinizing Chair Powell's comments amid ongoing political pressure over future leadership; investors also watch US fiscal discussions and heavy mega-cap tech earnings.

items.title: Tesla Shares Rise 4% on Musk's Optimus, Robotaxi, and FSD Announcements at Davos
items.summary: Elon Musk announced full self-driving approval in Europe and China as early as February, US robotaxi deployment by year-end, and Optimus consumer rollout by 2027 end, boosting Tesla amid WEF discussions.

items.title: Yen Surges on Suspected Coordinated Intervention, US Treasury Yields Fall
items.summary: Japanese yen rallied massively Friday amid signs of intervention; US treasury yields pushed lower while Japanese government bonds stayed steady.

items.title: Magnificent Seven Earnings Week: Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, Apple Ahead
items.summary: Tech giants Microsoft, Meta, Tesla, and Apple set to report earnings this week, driving sector focus alongside Intel's post-earnings plunge and Capital One's 7.6% drop after missing profits.

items.title: Hang Seng Consolidates Near 26,800, Japan 225 Recovers; VIX Subdued but Cautious
items.summary: Hang Seng dipped 0.3% but holds uptrend above 20-day MA; Japan 225 rebounded post-tax relief; VIX stayed low but short-dated volatility rose amid geopolitical tensions and tariff concerns.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Slumps 11% from Monthly High Below $87K Amid Market-Wide Decline
items.summary: Bitcoin has dropped 11% from its monthly high, trading below $87,000 as part of a broader crypto market slump. The decline follows heavy weekend selling pressure, wiping out over $500 million in derivatives positions.

items.title: Ethereum Foundation Declares Post-Quantum Security Top Strategic Priority
items.summary: The Ethereum Foundation has elevated post-quantum (PQ) security to its highest strategic level, launching a $1 million Poseidon Prize and biweekly developer calls. This includes AI-aided research and a forthcoming detailed roadmap to protect against quantum threats without network disruption.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops Nearly 3% Over Weekend, Analyst Predicts Downside to $85K, $74K, $53K
items.summary: Bitcoin lost almost 3% over the weekend due to global risk aversion, yen carry-trade fears, US policy uncertainty, and ETF outflows, plunging $4,000 in two hours. It trades at $87,665 after a slight Monday rebound but remains below key moving averages.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Datavault AI Supports Launch of RWA International Research Center in Taiwan
items.summary: Datavault AI is partnering with St. John's University in Taipei to establish the RWA International Research Center, focusing on real-world asset digitization, tokenization frameworks, and financial innovation. The center's inauguration is set for January 26, 2026, promoting industry-academia collaboration.[7]

items.title: Testlio Launches LeoInsights AI-Powered QA Platform
items.summary: Testlio introduced LeoInsights, an AI-driven quality assurance analysis tool powered by the LeoAI Engine, trained on 13 years of data including 2.6 million test cases, to provide summaries of changes, risks, and issues in software testing.[2]

items.title: Shanghai Jiao Tong University Advances Fast AI for Satellite CO2 Monitoring
items.summary: Researchers from Shanghai Jiao Tong University developed a probabilistic machine learning framework for satellite trace gas retrievals, matching physics-based accuracy while being thousands of times faster, with applications in climate monitoring.[3]

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Midas Labs Announces Playmaker AI Game Creation Platform for Q2 2026
items.summary: Midas Labs revealed Playmaker, an AI-powered platform for game creation, funding, and publishing, set to launch in Q2 2026. It integrates with the UNIFI ecosystem and uses the $PLAY token for transactions.

items.title: Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven and Arknights: Endfield Release, Impacting Fantasy Critic League
items.summary: Cult of the Lamb: Woolhaven and Arknights: Endfield launched recently, updating the TAGN Fantasy Critic League scoreboard and boosting Green River Gaming to second place. Other updates include confirmed release dates for Forza Horizon 6 on May 19, 2026.

items.title: 2P Games Announces R.I.P. - Reincarnation, Vampire Survivors Meets Diablo Roguelike
items.summary: 2P Games and WarmCore Studio announced R.I.P. - Reincarnation, a post-apocalyptic bullet heaven roguelike blending Vampire Survivors and Diablo styles.

items.title: Dreadway Review: Lethal Company-Inspired Co-op Horror Game
items.summary: Dreadway, a PC co-op horror game likened to 'Lethal Company at home,' received a review on January 26, 2026.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Concurrent Technologies Launches Kratos (32 Core) CPU
items.summary: Concurrent Technologies Plc announced the launch of its new Kratos (32 Core) CPU, offering up to 60% more processing power than the original 20-core version for mission-critical C4ISR applications in defense. The product expands the company's market in rugged embedded computing with no direct competitors in the VPX standard.

items.title: Intel Shares Plunge 17% on Disappointing Guidance
items.summary: Intel's stock dropped as much as 17% following weak guidance and struggles to meet demand for AI chips, highlighting challenges in the semiconductor sector.

items.title: Pop Mart Shares Surge 23% on Buyback Program Announcement
items.summary: Pop Mart's stock rose 23% after announcing its first share buyback program in two years, boosting investor confidence amid positive corporate developments.

items.title: Baidu Launches Driverless Taxi Services in Abu Dhabi
items.summary: Baidu rallied 10% after launching driverless taxi services in Abu Dhabi and updating its services, marking expansion in autonomous vehicle operations.

items.title: Alibaba Restructures Chipmaking Division T-Head Semiconductor
items.summary: Alibaba's shares advanced 1% on reports of restructuring its T-Head Semiconductor division, potentially paving the way for an independent listing.
